channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Watch out for these Social Security and Medicare sign-up traps that could cost you thousands of dollars
item.description: Applying for retirement benefits can be confusing, and it’s all too easy to end up with permanent cuts to your benefits.

item.title: UnitedHealth stock has plunged since Brian Thompson’s murder. The CEO now is calling for healthcare reform.
item.description: UnitedHealth’s chief executive on Friday called for the healthcare system to be overhauled, following the emotional and angry reaction many had to the...

item.title: Gold Price Action to Be Driven by U.S. Interest Rates, BMI Says
item.description: Gold futures were lower, and Fitch said it’s probable the Fed will take a more cautious approach to interest rate cuts, and that while it expects pric...

item.title: Macron expected to name France’s new prime minister on Friday morning
item.description: Emmanuel Macron is expected to name France’s new prime minister on Friday. The French president met with centrist politician François Bayrou earlier i...

item.title: Is business school worth it? Here are the worst reasons to get an M.B.A.
item.description: Applications to M.B.A. programs have increased sharply this year. Here’s how to tell if business school is right for you.

item.title: How Seniors Can Donate More to Charity and Pay Less in Taxes
item.description: While all Americans can get tax breaks for giving, those 70½ or older have the best choices. Here’s the rundown on two key tax-favored ways to give.

item.title: Your Home-Insurance Bill Has Only One Way to Go: Up
item.description: Damage from hail is fueling a jump in insurance claims as more homes are built in disaster-prone areas.

item.title: Nasdaq Futures Lead Gains; Broadcom Rallies
item.description: Stock futures were higher, with the tech-focused Nasdaq-100 leading gains.

item.title: Dollar Stores Are Flashing a Warning Sign About Lower-Income Consumers
item.description: Such businesses started seeing signs of belt-tightening from their core customers earlier this year.

item.title: My husband filed for divorce. He did not contribute one penny towards the mortgage. Is he entitled to half of our home?
item.description: “He forced me to pay every payment.”
